meanings.definition: A person who causes harm or suffering to others.
meanings.sent1: The inflictor of pain was finally brought to justice.
meanings.sent2: The inflictor of the injury fled the scene before anyone could identify them.
meanings.sent3: The inflictor of bad jokes always made everyone groan.
meanings.sent4: The inflictor of chaos seemed to revel in the destruction they caused.
meanings.sent5: The inflictor of misery haunted the dreams of the villagers.

meanings.definition: To impose something unwelcome or harmful on someone.
meanings.sent1: She would never intentionally inflictor harm on her friends.
meanings.sent2: The bully tried to inflictor fear in his classmates.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally inflictor a burnt taste to the dish.
meanings.sent4: The storm inflictor damage to the fragile ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The villain sought to inflictor pain on the hero's loved ones.
